Author: Riddlez666#9550
Content: @artemciy_dice maybe you have the answers im looking for?

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content:
Hi, @Riddlez666 !

I might be wrong, but I'd start with finding the coins file and adding your coin there. The file format is described at https://github.com/jl777/coins.

You can probably experiment with this by modifying the coins file that comes with the HyperDEX, I think they have it somewhere (cf. https://github.com/atomiclabs/hyperdex/blob/1d4ed3234b482e769124725c7e979eef5cd72d24/app/marketmaker/supported-currencies.js).

@artem.pikulin#0794 should be able to help you further tomorrow, and you're welcome to ask in #dev-marketmaker and/or the older #dev-tradebots channels.

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content:
`> there quite a few ETH clones around doing different things will they be supported?`

If they have a compatible wallet API and/or Electrum servers, or if there's interest in helping us implement the necessary changes, then sure, why not?

Author: Riddlez666#9550
Content: thats why im hear as all info ive found seems slim and sparse, and want to be able to swap on the platform with our chain

Author: Riddlez666#9550
Content: should i take my chat to another channel @artemciy_dice as i have questions and don't wanna hijack this chan

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content: Yeah, I think that #dev-tradebots is closer to the subject of coin integraions.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if there is a infuria type of support that can be used, it shouldnt be too much work to add

Author: Riddlez666#9550
Content: just need a list of requirements of API and i can make it happen as i would love to work towards getting the other ETH variants on the platform

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it needs to provide the same thing ETH does

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i dont know the details, but if we are using ETH infuria servers (which I think we are), then the clone would need to be running infuria servers on the clone ETH

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
we are running parity nodes for the ETH chain. They are defined here: https://github.com/jl777/coins/blob/master/ethereum/ETH together with the "swap_contract_address". I think the same contract must be deployed on the other chain.
ETH is enabled like this: `curl --url "http://127.0.0.1:7783" --data "{\"userpass\":\"$userpass\",\"method\":\"enable\",\"coin\":\"ETH\",\"urls\":[\"http://electrum1.cipig.net:8555\",\"http://electrum2.cipig.net:8555\",\"http://electrum3.cipig.net:8555\"],\"swap_contract_address\":\"0x8500AFc0bc5214728082163326C2FF0C73f4a871\",\"mm2\":1}"`
it contains the parity nodes defined in the above file and the contract address from the same file. I suppose this would also work with other ETH clones, but @artem.pikulin can tell us more for sure.

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: I have 2 Dex now, will that be enough to get a piece of the distributed fees or do i need more to not be a fraction and miss out?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 2/1000000 would be your revshare

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: probably not enough

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: Do you have ballpark figure what i need?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no idea what percentage of revshare you need

Author: CoinKing88#1540

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 2 DEX will get 2/1000000 of the revshare

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is proportional to the number of DEX you have

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: I understand but is the amount of fee to be distributed over all 1 million Dex a variable to determine if a revshare is sent to the Dex holder?

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: Or only the x/1.000.000

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: when there is $1 mil worth to distributed it will be sent out, since DEX gets 50% of all revenues, 2 DEX will in that case get you $1

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: But earlier you said 2 Dex is nog enough to get that 1 dollar?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i didnt say that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 2 DEX will get 2 millionths of revshare

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i keep repeating this

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is just simple math

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: Ok my bad, a comment from you a few weeks back confused me. Then you talked about fractions being too small to receive revshare. I may have interpreted that wrong

Content: Thanks for your responses

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it ends up being less than 0.001 or whatever the dust threshold is, then it wont

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but with million dollars flowing into it, having even 2 you will get some
